unit_learning_outcomes.description: Use feedback from teachers, clinicians, peers and patients to inform self-evaluation and critical reflection of knowledge and skill development (Professional)

Demonstrate safe, effective, patient-centred skills and competencies in delivering high quality assessment and management strategies for facilitating wellness during cancer treatment and beyond (Clinical Practitioner)
Demonstrate evidence based best practice management skills for facilitating wellness during cancer treatment and beyond (Scientist and Scholar)
Discuss strategies to enhance quality life and promote health after cancer treatment (Clinical Practitioner)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: A  component of this micro unit will be presented as a series of well designed learning activities with embedded readings and knowledge checks.

enrolment_rules.description: AQF level 7 in a health degree or recognised equivalent with national registration if required.

assessments.description: Multiple choice questions and short answer

data.subject_search_title: LYMP8009 - Wellness During Cancer Treatment and Beyond

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is one of a series of units examining specialist skill areas of clinical practice within lymphoedema and related areas of management and clinical relevance. In this unit you will develop an understanding and insight into the management of “Wellness during cancer treatment and beyond” for individuals undergoing cancer treatment and the survivorship phase. In this unit you will develop an understanding and insight into how cancer and its treatments impact an individual physically, functionally, psychologically, and financially. This unit will cover comprehensive assessment, clinical reasoning, communication and management skills to treat individuals diagnosed with cancer. You will understand factors that influence physical function and quality of life in patients following cancer treatment such as fatigue, body image, sexuality and lymphoedema; know why and when to use assessments including pre-treatment, during treatment, and post-cancer treatment; understand theory for various treatment modalities and apply principles of chronic disease management to tailor intervention to the condition and individual goals. You will be encouraged to reflect on your own development. The unit will assist your development of the Scientist and Scholar, Clinical Practitioner and Professional graduate capabilities.
